str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From apostello; a delegate; specially, an ambassador of the Gospel; officially a commissioner of Christ.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To turn back, return. From hupo and strepho; to turn under, i.e. To return.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To relate in full, describe, narrate. From dia and hegeomai; to relate fully.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Plural
str2: How much, how great, how many, as great as, as much. By reduplication from hos; as As.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: (a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause. Apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From para and lambano; to receive near, i.e. Associate with oneself; by analogy, to assume an office; figuratively, to learn.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Pertaining to self, i.e. One's own; by implication, private or separate.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To withdraw, retire, go back, retreat. From hupo and choreo; to vacate down, i.e. Retire quietly.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
A city, the inhabitants of a city. Probably from the same as polemos, or perhaps from polus; a town.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Feminine Singular
str2: (a) I call, summon, invite, (b) I call, name. Akin to the base of keleuo; to 'call'.
Of Chaldee origin; fishing-house; Bethsaida, a place in Palestine.
